actor_awards.notes: Armstrong's career was cut short by personal struggles, but he achieved immortality in the fantasy genre as Jason. His voice in 'Jason and the Argonauts' was famously dubbed by British actor Tim Turner.

filmography.title: Jason and the Argonauts
filmography.role_description: The legendary Greek hero who leads a crew of adventurers on the perilous ship Argo to find the Golden Fleece and claim his rightful throne.
filmography.plot: The legendary Greek hero Jason is sent by the murderous King Pelias to find the Golden Fleece. He assembles a crew of heroes and endures the wrath of the gods and attacks by harpies and a skeleton army.

filmography.title: King Rat
filmography.role_description: An American prisoner of war in a Japanese camp who is part of the inner circle of the charismatic and manipulative Corporal King.
filmography.plot: In a Japanese POW camp during World War II, a corporal manipulates his way to a comfortable life, breeding rats to sell as food to his starving fellow prisoners.

filmography.title: Walk on the Wild Side
filmography.role_description: A supporting role as a police lieutenant in this gritty drama set in 1930s New Orleans; Armstrong was credited as 'Todd Anderson' for this debut role.
filmography.plot: A Texas farmer travels to New Orleans to find his lost love, only to discover she is working in a high-class brothel run by a ruthless madam.

filmography.title: Five Finger Exercise
filmography.role_description: A young American who becomes involved in the domestic turbulence of a wealthy family when a German tutor arrives.
filmography.plot: A young German tutor disrupts the delicate balance of a wealthy California family, exposing their hidden secrets and prejudices.

filmography.title: Dead Heat on a Merry-Go-Round
filmography.role_description: A key member of a con artist's team assembled to pull off an intricate bank heist at the Los Angeles airport.
filmography.plot: A charming con man seduces and manipulates several women to fund and execute a daring bank robbery at LAX during a diplomatic visit.

filmography.title: A Time for Killing
filmography.role_description: A Confederate lieutenant who escapes a Union prison camp and joins a violent trek toward the Mexican border.
filmography.plot: Confederate prisoners escape a Union camp and head for Mexico, unaware that the war has ended, while a Union major pursues them.

filmography.title: Winnetou and the Crossbreed
filmography.role_description: A frontiersman who teams up with the Apache chief Winnetou and Old Firehand to defend a town from a bandit gang.
filmography.plot: The Apache chief Winnetou and his friend Old Firehand help a group of settlers defend their town against a gang of ruthless outlaws led by the villain Silers.

filmography.title: Scalplock
filmography.role_description: A railroad man who works with gambler Ben Calhoun to win a railroad line in a poker game; this TV movie served as the pilot for the series 'The Iron Horse'.
filmography.plot: A gambler wins a railroad in a poker game and faces numerous challenges, including sabotage and financial ruin, as he tries to make it profitable.

filmography.title: Shackleton (Icebound in the Antarctic)
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this historical drama depicting the perilous journey of explorer Ernest Shackleton; this was Armstrong's final screen appearance.
filmography.plot: The true story of Sir Ernest Shackleton's 1914 expedition to the South Pole, where his ship was crushed by ice, leaving the crew stranded.
filmography.awards: BAFTA TV: Win – Best Drama Series

filmography.title: The Silencers
filmography.role_description: A small, uncredited role as a guard in this spy spoof starring Dean Martin as Matt Helm.
filmography.plot: Secret agent Matt Helm is pulled out of retirement to stop an evil organization called BIG O from instigating a nuclear war.

filmography.title: Manhunt (TV Series)
filmography.role_description: Armstrong's first major role, playing a young police detective in 13 episodes of this syndicated crime drama alongside Victor Jory.
filmography.plot: A crime drama following the cases of the San Diego Police Department and Detective Lieutenant Howard Finucane.

filmography.title: Gunsmoke (Ep: 9:12 to Dodge)
filmography.role_description: An outlaw being transported by Marshal Matt Dillon on a train who plots his escape with the help of his gang.
filmography.plot: Marshal Dillon and Doc Adams escort an outlaw on a train to Dodge City, but they face threats from the prisoner's gang and a meddlesome passenger.

filmography.title: Gunsmoke (Ep: The First People)
filmography.role_description: An Arapaho police officer who clashes with Matt Dillon over the handling of a crime involving his people.
filmography.plot: Matt Dillon is forced to arrest an Arapaho policeman for murder, sparking racial tensions and a conflict of justice.

filmography.title: Hawaii Five-O (Ep: Target? The Lady)
filmography.role_description: A gambler with connections to the underworld who becomes a murder victim, setting off the investigation.
filmography.plot: Five-O investigates the murder of a gambler and races to find a female courier before a hitman can silence her.

filmography.title: Nakia (Ep: The Driver)
filmography.role_description: A guest starring role in this short-lived series about a Native American deputy sheriff in New Mexico.
filmography.plot: Deputy Nakia Parker navigates the cultural divide between his Navajo heritage and his police duties while investigating a crime involving a getaway driver.

filmography.title: The Greatest American Hero (Ep: A Chicken in Every Plot)
filmography.role_description: An old friend of Bill Maxwell who gets caught up in a Caribbean island conspiracy involving voodoo and political assassination.
filmography.plot: Ralph and the team travel to a Caribbean island to visit Bill's friend, only to find him missing and the island in the grip of a voodoo cult.
